block.p: Elizabeth Eloise Harris, a daughter of Kathleen McKinley Harris and Dr. Everett Harris of Charlotte, Vt., was married yesterday afternoon to Daniel Bigman, a son of Carol and Larry Bigman of Brookfield, Conn. The Rev. Craig Smith performed the ceremony at Trinity Episcopal Church in Shelburne, Vt.

The couple work for Web sites in New York, the bride as a reporter for SmartMoney.com, which specializes in financial news, and the bridegroom as the producer in charge of business news at The New York Times on the Web.

Elizabeth Eloise Harris, a daughter of Kathleen McKinley Harris and Dr. Everett Harris of Charlotte, Vt., was married yesterday afternoon to Daniel Bigman, a son of Carol and Larry Bigman of Brookfield, Conn. The Rev. Craig Smith performed the ceremony at Trinity Episcopal Church in Shelburne, Vt.

The couple work for Web sites in New York, the bride as a reporter for SmartMoney.com, which specializes in financial news, and the bridegroom as the producer in charge of business news at The New York Times on the Web.

The bride, 25, will continue to use her name professionally. She graduated from Wellesley College. Her father, who is retired, was an associate professor of adult education at the College of Agriculture at the University of Vermont in Burlington. He is now a consultant on vocational and technical education to the Vermont Department of Education. Her mother writes children's books and poetry.

Mr. Bigman, 30, graduated from Emerson College. His mother owns Exposition Associates, a company in Brookfield that produces the Intimate Apparel Salon, a trade show in New York. His father, who is retired, was a commercial photographer based in Brookfield.
